overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains a presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, totaling 3580 followers. His content focuses on research related to social media analysis, disinformation, and computational social science. Engagement varies by platform, with LinkedIn showing a higher level of interaction in terms of likes and comments.

contentThemes.description: Posts related to research findings, publications, and methodologies in computational social science.
Content focusing on the study and detection of disinformation campaigns and coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Posts announcing research positions, PhD opportunities, and calls for collaborators.
Announcements of upcoming conference presentations and participation in relevant events.

recommendations: Increase cross-platform promotion to drive followers to different platforms.
Experiment with different content formats (e.g., video, infographics) to boost engagement.
Actively participate in relevant conversations and engage with followers' comments and questions.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky content focusing on research publications and conference participation sees good engagement, especially in reposts, indicating a strong interest in research updates and community events.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon posts are more focused on technical updates and discussions, but receive moderate engagement. Consider sharing more visually appealing content or engaging in more direct Q&A to increase interaction.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn is the most engaging platform, likely due to its professional audience. Leverage this by continuing to share research updates, job opportunities, and insights relevant to the industry.
